page.title: 16Wootton Weather June 1985
page.content: At Wootton Primary School the children take weather recordings each day.This includes taking the maximum and minimum temperatures as well as the soil temperature.Using an instrument called a ventimeter,the children record the force,speed and direction of the wind. The children also record cloud cover as well as a general description of a particular day's weather. During the recording of the Domesday Survey,in June 1985,the weather has been particularly bad.It has been the wettest June for over 25 years.The temperature has barely risen above 14 degrees centigrade.It has been cold,wet and miserable.
